poll_list.title: Ratification Poll for Onboard/Amend Keep3r Network (MIP63c4-SP4) - June 13, 2022

discourse_list.title: MIP63c4-SP4: Onboard/Amend Keeper Network - Keep3r Network

content.content: MIP63c4-SP4: Onboard/Amend Keeper Network - Keep3r Network  Preamble MIP63c4-SP#: 4 Title: Onboard/Amend Keeper Network - Keep3r Network Author(s): 0xPEPO (@0xPEPO) Contributors: Tags: keeper-network Status: Accepted Date Proposed: 2022-03-30 Date Ratified: 2022-06-27 Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip63c4-sp4-onboard-amend-keeper-network/14321 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmXbgVGz   Specification   Name: Keep3r Network  Short Name: KEEP3R  Website: https://keep3r.network/    Requested Budget: 1,000 DAI / day  Requested Buffer Min: 4,000 DAI  Requested Buffer Max: 20,000 DAI  Chain: All  Address to Stream DAI to: 0xc6A048550C9553F8Ac20fbdeB06f114c27ECcabb    Network Description This is a budget amendment application for Keep3r Network: a decentralized and permissionless keeper network.  Background As explained by hexonaut on the Gelato’s MIP63c4 proposal, we have created a Dune Analytics dashboard to showcase the cost of execution during the time our keepers were active. During the 1 month period our network was active on Maker’s Keeper Network, we had an expenditure of 1.48 ETH (4800 USD at the time of writing), we expect this cost to be within that range (4,000 - 5,000 USD per month) and thus why we’ve decided to suggest a 4,000 Min Buffer limit. The suggested 20,000 Max Buffer limit is taken into account due to potential gas spikes and the likelihood of more jobs coming to the network within the next few months, this will allow us to sustain the workload on the jobs without having to amend the budget every few weeks (all of this taken into account considering that the contract will be programmed to return any excess above the Max Buffer to the surplus buffer). We plan to continue to support and expand tooling in order to facilitate Maker’s ability to track the performance of Keep3r Network within its own Keeper Network.  Resources  Keep3r Network - MakerDAO Job Keep3r Network - Analytics   Expected Coverage  ALL
content.GPT-summary: The post is a proposal for a budget amendment application for Keep3r Network, a decentralized and permissionless keeper network. The author explains the background and provides details on the requested budget, buffer min and max, and the network description. The post also includes resources and expected coverage. A 3rd party gives entirely positive feedback on the proposal, while another 3rd party provides constructive criticism and suggests collaboration. The proposal is open for auditing and reviewing.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: edit: updated the “Address to Stream DAI to” with the current contract address

Due to an oversight (of which I’m particularly responsible) this proposal didn’t make it into May’s Governance Cycle. Instead, it will enter June’s Governance Cycle, with its Ratification Poll going up on Monday 13. We’re sorry for the somewhat eccentric situation. Because of this mistake, this proposal may not have been reviewed by the Maker Community. We encourage @Recognized-Delegates and other community members to voice opinions on this proposal ASAP. This thread should be reserved for comments on the proposal; any concern about the process or GovAlpha’s mistake should be directed to the forthcoming post mortem, expected later today. Thank you.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: I was actually wondering a month ago—what had happened to this proposal — I was under the impression that perhaps 0xPepo had pulled it. All good. We believe this allowance for the applicant (Keep3r) along w/Gelato is needed for the gradual diversification of Maker keepers, and it includes a min/max buffer as detailed in the proposal. When max is reached the excess is returned to the SB. Supported.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: Hey @blimpa and @flipflopflapdelegate thanks for the bump on the thread, no worries and we are really grateful to work together on this. Again, if at any point there is a concern / issue regarding the performance of Keep3r within Maker’s Keeper Network, you can contact me through telegram (@vPEPO) or twitter (@0xPEPO) and we will try to fix any arising issue asap. We are in active communication with Sam (hexonaut), but wanted to also extend the offer to anyone interested on this topic within Maker as well.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: This proposal is currently being voted on. Its RP will run from 06/13 to 06/27. Please vote here.

Just following up on this thread. The initially deployed contract could not claim the funds from the DssVest stream that was originally set up through the 2022-07-06 executive spell. A new contract has now been deployed. The executive spell scheduled for 2022-08-03 will cancel the previous stream (stream ID: 8) and a new DssVest stream will be created, which will stream DAI to  0x37b375e3D418fbECba6b283e704F840AB32f3b3C. This new stream will be back-dated to 2022-07-01. (cc: @hexonaut, @0xPEPO)
